meanings.definition: An introductory statement in a document or speech.
meanings.sent1: The preambles of the book set the stage for the exciting adventure ahead.
meanings.sent2: The preamble of the constitution outlines the fundamental principles of the country.
meanings.sent3: The preambles of the play made the audience eager to see what would happen next.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a preamble to a beautiful story waiting to unfold.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's preamble captured the students' attention right from the start.

meanings.definition: A preliminary or preparatory statement; an introduction.
meanings.sent1: Before the main event, there was a short preamble to explain the rules.
meanings.sent2: The speaker began his speech with a brief preamble to set the context.
meanings.sent3: The preamble to the meeting was unexpectedly funny, lightening the mood.
meanings.sent4: The preamble to the concert was like a gentle invitation to a magical world.
meanings.sent5: The preamble to the story hinted at the exciting twists to come.
